entry.title: SAP BTP Job Scheduling Service Using Alert Notification Service ANS
entry.content:
In this Blog an SAP Integration Suite landscape, it's common for mission-critical integration flows to be executed. In the event of a failure within such a flow—especially one of high importance—it becomes necessary to immediately notify the responsible stakeholders. This is achieved by integrating SAP Integration Suite with the SAP Alert Notification Service (ANS).

Event Source: SAP Integration Suite

SAP Integration Suite acts as the event source. When an error or failure occurs within an integration flow, the system can be configured to emit an event. This event is then captured by SAP Alert Notification Service to trigger a corresponding notification.

Configuration Steps in Alert Notification Service

To set up this event-driven alerting mechanism, follow these key steps in SAP Alert Notification Service:

  1. Define an Action
    An action determines what should happen when a condition is met—for example, sending an email, posting to a Microsoft Teams channel, or triggering a webhook.

  2. Create a Condition
    A condition specifies the criteria under which the action should be triggered. For example, "IF Integration Flow 'XYZ' fails" or "IF status = ERROR".

  3. Establish a Subscription
    The subscription links the condition to the action. Here, you define:

    • Scope (e.g., subaccount or application level)

    • Event type (e.g., Integration Flow Error)

    • Target channel (e.g., Email, Microsoft Teams, Slack)

Notification Delivery Channels

When the subscription is triggered, the defined action is executed. Depending on your configuration, this could result in:

  • Email alerts to support teams

  • Real-time messages in collaboration tools like Microsoft Teams

  • Logging or escalation in external systems via webhooks or APIs

Integration with Cloud Foundry Applications

If your application is deployed in the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment, you can bind the Alert Notification Service instance directly to your application. This enables:

  • Automatic alert generation for lifecycle events (e.g., app crashes, restarts)

  • Security-related events (e.g., user assignments or role changes)

  • Operational events for application monitoring

 

 

 

 

Actions

The action defines what will be executed when SAP Alert Notification receives an event from the Job Scheduler. A variety of actions are supported, including sending an email, sending a Microsoft Teams message, calling a webhook, and others.

In this example, we will configure the email option.

Important: According to SAP Help documentation, it is not possible to specify more than one email address directly. However, a common workaround is to use an email distribution list. By sending the alert to a distribution list address, multiple recipients can be notified simultaneously. 

This is the complete list of actions: 
https://help.sap.com/docs/ALERT_NOTIFICATION/5967a369d4b74f7a9c2b91f5df8e6ab6/8a7e092eebc74b3ea01d50... 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Conditions
The condition is a filter to define which alerts/messages we want to work for our listener.

https://help.sap.com/docs/ALERT_NOTIFICATION/5967a369d4b74f7a9c2b91f5df8e6ab6/35ca5de101fc4d5791cdbb... 
 
For the job scheduler, you can configure it according to your needs using the following help 
 
https://help.sap.com/docs/alert-notification/sap-alert-notification-for-sap-btp/jobscheduler-job-exe... 

For example, to receive any Job Scheduler alert/message we can create a condition for the eventType JobFailureCondition.

Subscription
The Subscription acts as a listener that monitors events triggered by the Job Scheduler. In our case, it listens specifically for events with the event type JobFailureCondition.

We associate Conditions and Actions with the Subscription. When the Job Scheduler triggers an event of type JobFailureCondition, the Subscription evaluates the defined Conditions. If the Conditions are met, the associated Actions are executed accordingly.

 

 

 

Send Test Event

{
  "eventType": "sampleType",
  "resource": {
    "resourceName": "sampleName",
    "resourceType": "sampleType",
    "tags": {
      "sampleTag": "sampleValue"
    }
  },
  "severity": "FATAL",
  "category": "ALERT",
  "subject": "Sample Event Subject",
  "body": "Sample event body.",
  "tags": {
    "ans:correlationId": "30118",
    "ans:status": "CREATE_OR_UPDATE",
    "customTag": "customTagValue"
  }
}

 

 

Conclusion 
By integrating SAP Job Scheduler with SAP Alert Notification Service, you can automate critical monitoring tasks and ensure rapid response to failures in your SAP BTP landscape. This setup is essential for maintaining operational continuity and proactive system management. Scenario of using this where timely alerts can help detect deployment issues early and reduce.

Get SAP-Certified in Low-Code/No-Code Development: What You Need to Know
entry.content:
SAP offers a certification for Low-Code/No-Code developers, specifically focused on SAP Build. For those working in enterprise development or considering how to extend their skill set into more agile application delivery, this certification validates your ability to design, develop, and automate processes with minimal or no coding.

 

Why It Matters
SAP Build tools are increasingly integral to business process transformation. The certification covers:

  • SAP Build Apps – application development using declarative logic and reusable components.
  • SAP Build Work Zone – centralized workspaces integrating apps, content, and tasks.
  • SAP Build Process Automation – visual tools for workflows, business rules, and bots.

Even experienced developers can benefit from mastering these platforms to complement traditional development approaches, especially for rapid prototyping and business-led innovation.

 

The Certification Path

 

  1. Self-Guided Learning Journeys
  • SAP Build Apps: Learn how to design front-end interfaces, bind data sources, and configure logic flows — all without code.
  • SAP Build Work Zone: Understand workspace creation, content integration, and personalization.
  • SAP Build Process Automation: Gain skills in workflow design, rule configuration, and automation bot setup.
  1. Practical Application: A guided, end-to-end hands-on exercise simulates real-world scenarios. This is a required step before taking the certification and ensures applied learning.
  2. Certification Exam: Once ready, schedule the exam to validate your LCNC expertise within the SAP ecosystem.

 

Extend Your Learning and Network

 

  • Watch SAP Developer Advocates on YouTube for advanced tutorials and use cases.
  • Attend SAP CodeJam events for collaborative learning.
  • Subscribe to SAP Learning Hub for deeper, structured content.

This certification isn’t just about earning a badge — it’s a way to stay current with SAP’s evolving platform and expand how you deliver value.

entry.title: Top 10 SAP Cloud ALM News July 2025
entry.content:
Are you ready for the newest updates in SAP Cloud ALM of July 2025?

Then you should check out our TOP 10 Features of the Month that will support you with staying innovative and give you guidance to optimize your SAP Cloud ALM landscape.

Let’s dive into the world of Application Lifecycle Management together and explore the newest updates in implementation and operations!

 

IMPLEMENTATION UPDATES

1. Enhanced Defect Management in Features App

You can now directly assign and unassign defects to features that are in the "In Implementation" or "In Testing" status within the Features app.

For more details, please refer to Working with Defects.

 

2. Master Your Timeline: Custom milestones, sprints, and phases

Discover our latest update for task management and start defining Timelines. In the Guided Implementation app, you can now create and edit milestones, sprints, and phases to get your projects streamlined with greater precision and ease.

 

3. Streamlined Test Preparation with Country/Region Filters for Diagrams

When creating a test case, you can now see the countries/regions for which the available solution process flow diagrams are relevant. This helps you choose exactly the right country/region diagram version for which the test case should be created.

Check out this blog post if you want to know more about the country/region concept for SAP Cloud ALM.

 

4. Enhanced Side Panel Feature in Solution Process Traceability App

The newly introduced side panel feature in the Solution Process Traceability app consolidates information from popovers into a dynamic table format. This improvement provides a seamless and uniform user experience across various applications. With this update, you can now effortlessly access information and tailor the table display settings to minimize irrelevant data.

 

 

5. Simplify Component Selection for New Solutions in Process Authoring App

When creating a new solution process, you can assign it to one or more solution components. To help you quickly find the desired component, the selection screen now features a filter section alongside the search option. This allows you to filter by Type, Deployment Unit, and Deployment Type, making it unnecessary to browse the entire list. Additionally, you can sort the table by various columns or choose to hide the filter area entirely if it's not required. A field at the bottom of the dialog box displays the currently selected solution components.

 

6. Enriched Configurations Management for Solution Activities

When you call up the details for a solution activity in the Solution Activities list within Process Authoring, you now can see any Configurations that are assigned to it, along with their IDs and respective categories.  Furthermore, after entering Edit mode, you can now also Assign and Unassign configurations for the selected solution activity directly within this list. 

 

Note

The name of the configuration is an active link that allows you to call up its details directly in the Libraries app.     

 

 

 

OPERATIONS UPDATES

7. New Anomaly Detection Feature for Message Processing

You can now create events based on anomalies in message processing volume for a system over a specified period. Define anomalies and set up event actions to address potential issues proactively. This feature allows users to configure warning and critical limits for message volume, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.

For details on configuring this event, refer to Anomalies Detected in Message Processing Event.

 

8. Custom KPIs for ABAP-based Components in Business Process Monitoring

You can now create custom KPIs for components based on ABAP, such as:

  • SAP Business Suite 7
  • SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

Prerequisite: You've implemented ST-PI version 7.40 SP31 and activated business process monitoring and the data collection.

For more information, see Custom KPIs on the SAP Help Portal.

 

9. Expanded Download Options for Change Analysis

The Changes page now offers enhanced flexibility for downloading entries from the System and Changes in Time Frame Selection table. You can choose from the following options:

  • Download Table: Export the entries from the System and Changes in Time Frame Selection table.
  • Download Table with Changed Items: Export the entries along with detailed information about all changes made to individual items. Selecting this option will download a separate file for each system, including data on all changed items within the system.

 

10. Contractual Maintenance Window Events in Business Service Management

You can now receive Contractual Maintenance Window events in the Business Service Management app. These events are generated by SAP and can be viewed in the private cloud workspace within SAP for Me and in the Event Calendar. They typically serve as placeholders for potential maintenance or downtime events.

---------------------------------------------------

Stay tuned for future editions where we’ll continue to bring you the newest innovations and improvements in SAP Cloud ALM and explore the SAP Help Portal!

Embrace the chance to transform your business and achieve the next levels of success.

Happy innovating! 🚀

entry.title: SAP Datasphere Replication Flow Logs: Monitoring & Insights
entry.content:
Introduction

Replication Flow is one of the key artifcate to integrate data from SAP and NON-SAP source system to Datasphere or outside world.

In this blog, we’ll s see how to track Replication Flow execution by accessing key metadata tables and diagnostic views within SAP Datasphere.

 

Step by Step Implementation

 

1) Create a  Database User Group

Begin by creating a global DB user to secure connectivity with underling SAP HANA Database.

Ensure you note down the Host, Port, Username and Password.

Link: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/9f804b8efa8043539289f42f372c4862/1097a470be40432e89f91288bdc14378.html 

2) Setup SAP HANA Connection

Establish a connection in your Datasphere space using:

  • Host
  • Port
  • Username
  • Password

This connection enables access to remote tables and metadata views critical for diagnostics.

3) Access Replication Metadata:

Go to Data builder ->  Import Remote table -> select SAP HANA connection.

serach for the space_name$TEC schema (space_name is your space name where Replication flow is created), under that schema import the REPLICATIONFLOW_RUN_DETAILS table.

4) Access Task Metadata:

Get all TASK Related Data from DWC_GLOBAL schema and view TASK_LOCKS_V_EXT

  • Import remote table
  • select SAP HANA connection
  • select DWC_GLOBAL schema
  • select TASK_LOGS_V_EXT view

5) Merge the data from both tables:

Join/Union both the tables and get all the required fields as per the requirement.

Conclusion

By building a model on top of these two tables, you can view all the metadata related to your Replication Flows. This helps you track key details like execution time, status, and any errors. So if something goes wrong, you'll be able to quickly identify and understand the issue.

Thanks

Vikas Parmar

SAP Datasphere  SAP Business Data Cloud

entry.title: Setting Up Cloud TMS for Various SAP SaaS Solutions
entry.content:
Although I’ve spent over 18 years in the SAP ecosystem and have written countless documents for both companies and customers, this is my first time writing a blog post for the SAP Community. Excited (and a bit curious) to see how it goes!😉

As we transition into the cloud era, the way we work is rapidly evolving. For years, we’ve relied on the classic STMS transaction for managing SAP transports. Over time, we saw the introduction of tools like CTS+ and HTA for non-ABAP systems, yet STMS has remained a mainstay — and likely will continue to be, as long as SAP runs on-premise or in private cloud environments.

But with the advent of SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), things are shifting. SAP is now encouraging the use of cloud-native transport mechanisms to move code into production. This brings us to Cloud Transport Management — also known as CTMS.

Many have already written blogs about setting up Cloud Transport Management (CTMS). However, in this blog, I’d like to take you through the CTMS setup for various SAP SaaS applications that I’ve had the opportunity to work on. Think of this as a one-stop guide for integrating CTMS with most of the SAP SaaS solutions available on SAP BTP.

Let's dive into it...

What is Cloud Transport Management and why do we need it? 

As many of you already know, it's a service in BTP, lets you manage software deliverables between accounts of different environments (such as Cloud Foundry, ABAP, and Neo). It also adds transparency to the audit trail of changes so that you get information about who performed which changes in your production environment, and when they did it.

Benefits and Features:

  • Better control of changes
  • Fully cloud-based
  • Integrated experience
  • Transport various types of content
  • Transport to different environments
  • Set up your transport landscape quickly
  • Complement CI/CD approaches
  • Flexibly handle imports

Supported Content Types:

  1. Multitarget Application archives (MTAs -.mtar files)
  2. BTP ABAP
  3. Application content
  4. Delivery units (DUs) of SAP HANA XS classic model

Plans and Pricing:

Setup Scenarios:

cTMS Setup is based on below 2 Scenarios

1.Transporting Content Archives Directly in the Application

  • Configure Entitlement
  • Subscribe to the cTMS Service
  • Set up the Role Collection
  • Create the Service Instance and Key

2.Transporting Content Archives from a Local File System

  • Configure Entitlement
  • Subscribe to the cTMS Service
  • Set up the Role Collection

Setup Steps:

Most of these SaaS applications follow scenario 1 here

Step1: Configuring Entitlement for cTMS

First, decide which subaccount should host the Cloud Transport Management Service (cTMS). You can either:

  • Use an existing subaccount where your applications are already running, or

  • Set up a dedicated subaccount solely for cTMS.

Recommendation: If cost is not a limiting factor, it's best to use a separate subaccount to keep transport management isolated and maintain a cleaner architecture.

Once you've selected the subaccount, follow these steps to assign entitlements:

  1. Go to your Global Account.

  2. Navigate to Entitlements > Entity Assignments.

  3. Select the subaccount where you want to subscribe to cTMS.

  4. Click on Configure Entitlements.

  5. Click Add Service Plans.

  6. Search for Cloud Transport Management.

  7. Under the service details, choose the appropriate service plans.

  8. Click Add Service Plans to finalize the entitlement.

Step2: Subscribe to cTMS

In the subaccount, navigate to Services → Service Marketplace and search for Cloud Transport Management.

Click on Actions and select Create.

In the dialog that appears, choose Standard Plan from the Plan dropdown menu, then click Create to proceed

Subscribed

Click Go to Application to launch the Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) application.

Step3: Setting Up Role Collections

To configure user access and permissions, set up role collections for the various roles available in Cloud Transport Management (cTMS).

After a successful subscription, SAP Cloud Transport Management provides two predefined role collections:

  • TMS_LandscapeOperator_RC for the Landscape Operator role

  • TMS_Viewer_RC for the Viewer role

These role templates are available by default, but you can also create custom role collections if needed and assign them to users accordingly. Typically, most team members are assigned the Viewer role, while the Admin role is managed by the SAP Basis team.

Step4: Create a Service Instance and Key

To create a service instance, ensure that a space has been set up in your subaccount.

  1. Navigate to Services → Instances and Subscriptions in your subaccount.

  2. Click Create to start the instance creation wizard.

  3. In the wizard, select the appropriate plan, runtime environment, space, and name for the service instance.

  4. Click Create to complete the setup.

Once the service instance is created, proceed to create a service key within the instance.

Important:
Do not share the service key via email or chat, as it contains sensitive credentials. Handle it securely. This key will be required when configuring destinations in your subaccount.

Step5: Configure the Landscape

Please go through below links for each SaaS Application specific Setup. 

  • cTMS Setup for CAP Applications
  • cTMS Setup for SAP Build Work Zone
  • cTMS Setup for SAP Datasphere
  • cTMS Setup for SAP SAC
  • cTMS Setup for Transporting BTP Role Collections
  • cTMS Setup for IntegrationSuite (CPI)

Step6: Integrate with Solution Manager

To integrate Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) with SAP Solution Manager (ChaRM / Focused Build), follow these steps:

1. Setup RFC Destinations in SAP Solution Manager

a. TMS_AUTHENTICATION

  • Host: <your-subaccount>.authentication.<domain>.com
    (Refer to the service key for the exact value)

  • Port: 443

  • Path Prefix: /oauth/token

  • Authentication Type: Basic Authentication

    • Use Client ID and Client Secret from the service key

  • SSL: Active

b. TMS_REST_API

  • Host: URI from the service key

  • Port: 443

  • Path Prefix: (leave blank)

  • Authentication: Do not use a user

  • SSL: Active

2. Create External Service in LMDB

In LMDB, create an External Service of type System using the following parameters:

  • Is Cloud TMS Node: X

  • Cloud TMS Node Name: Name of the node in cTMS (case-sensitive)

  • Cloud TMS Authentication RFC: TMS_AUTHENTICATION

  • Cloud TMS REST API RFC: TMS_REST_API

3. ChaRM / Focused Build Configuration

  • Assign the External Service to a Logical Component Group.

  • Link the Logical Component Group to your Solution.

  • Redefine the landscape within Solution Manager.

Step7: Integrate with Cloud ALM

If you're ready to integrate with Cloud ALM, the setup is straightforward. Simply create the following destination in your Cloud ALM subaccount. Keep in mind that you have separate Global and subaccounts for Cloud ALM. 

Name: use the prefix CALM_FTR_CTMS_

URL: Value of uri from the service key of your cTMS Service Key.

Authentication: OAuth2ClientCredentials

Client id, Secret from cTMS Service Key

Token Service URL: Value of URL (uaa section) from the service key

Conclusion: 

Now that you've learned what Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) is, including its benefits, cost, and how to subscribe and setup, what would be the best deployment approach. Should you keep cTMS within an existing subaccount, or create a dedicated one? You've also seen how cTMS can be integrated with both Solution Manager (SolMan) and Cloud ALM to enable change & deployment. 

Thank you for reading my blog and appreciate your feedback or any questions. 

Thanks,
Raghu

entry.title: Workarounds for Planning inconsistancies occuring due to MRP live
entry.content:
Planning Inconsistency during MRP run using MRP live

Introduction

             Material Requirements Planning (MRP) is one of the core components within the Production Planning module of SAP ERP. Its primary function is to ensure material availability by systematically evaluating demand (PIR, CIR, S/O), existing inventory and procurement proposals (PRs/POs), and generating new proposals to bridge any identified shortages. This is essential for smooth production operations and timely delivery schedules

             As the 21st century unfolded, it ushered into a new age – The digital age, the Fourth Industrial Revolution (4IR), our period is marked by rapid digital transformation across industries. Every facet of the supply chain is being shifted toward digitization as much as possible, driven by the need for increased speed, transparency, efficiency, connectivity and scalability. At the same time, the volume and complexity of global business transactions surged, placing unprecedented pressure on legacy systems.

            In response to these evolving market needs, enterprise resource planning systems required a significant upgrade. The modern market needs 4IR compliant features such as such as high-capacity data storage and data retrieval, cloud computing, integration with IoT networks, intelligent automation through AI-ML and system scalability.

            Recognizing this shift, SAP launched its next-generation business suite—SAP S/4HANA—in February 2015. One of its most transformative innovations (P.P. POV) was the introduction of MRP Live, a high-performance planning engine designed to meet the demands of real-time, data-driven operations, built to leverage the power of the HANA database, executes complex planning scenarios at unprecedented speed, with scalability and transparency tailored to the digital enterprise.

            However, as with any emerging technology during it’s infancy, MRP live also has it’s own constraints. More details of its restrictions are available on S/Note: 1914010. This article describes a scenario of planning inconsistency of MRP live and a work around to fix it.

Disclaimer

This observation is shared purely for educational purposes only and pertains to a specific scenario. MRP Live is a powerful and innovative tool, with high flexibility and possess robust cross-plant planning capabilities. The behavior noted here is an outlier case within a highly complex program. While a temporary workaround is suggested, it’s important to emphasize that, the final solution must come from SAP, as part of their continuous product improvement and support lifecycle."

Business Scenario

The material is maintained as a project stock. We maintain a planned independent requirement and procure the components, at the same time, we also receive sales orders. Sales order consumes PIR. Basically, it follows Planning with Final assembly, but with two changes:

  1. Since it’s under project stock, therefore for CIR, we assign assignment category “Q”
  2. The business scenario is such that, when S/O is created, Production order also need to be created automatically.

Configurations 

Practice scenario:

PIR:

Sales Order:

Stock Requirements screen:

We can observe two things

  1. Sales Order has consumed PIR.
  2. Production orders are created without MRP run as soon as Sales orders are saved.

Now Planning run using MRP live

 

Stock Requirements screen:

Pic: A

Creating a second sales order and executing MRP live:

Pic B

Observations

  1. Sales order consuming PIR properly – Working as per standard.
  2. Compare Pic A & B, for Planned orders created from PIR, the latest sales order details are populated, to its account assignment category – Planning inconsistency

Workarounds

Option 1: T-code: MD_MRP_FORCE_CLASSIC

To correct this planning inconsistency, we must force this material to plan in classic MRP, no matter if planning run is done via classic MRP or MRP live. Refer to S/Note: 2883907 for further information. Although we get the correct planning results, we lose the advantages of MRP live.

Planning run with MRP live.

Result

Observation:

  1. Now the S/O order details are not being populated to Planned orders created from PIRs, therefore no planning inconsistancies.

Option 2: Activate “Assign effectivity parameter values/ override change numbers”

Turn off the Classic MRP check box

Now when planned using MRP live, material will be again planned under MRP live program, leading to planning inconsistancies.

Now activate Assign effect. vals

Although the purpose of Assign effect. Vals is different, but according to S/Note: 1914010, MRP Live on HANA does not support parameter effectivity. Therefore, by default, the materials will be planned by Classic MRP.

These are the two workarounds to force materials to be planned using Classic MRP.

Summary

1. Although, MRP live is a very powerful tool, it has it's own limitations (S/Note: 1914010), that can cause inconsistancies in planning. Therefore sometimes we need to force the material to plan in Classical MRP at the cost of MRP live advantages. 

2. To force material to plan in classic MRP, use T-code: MD_MRP_FORCE_CLASSIC, and check the classic MRP box.

3. If you consider, MD_MRP_FORCE_CLASSIC, as additional step, you can simply check the "Assign effect. Vals" in basic data 1 view of material master. Although it's puspose is different, it server the purpose in this case.

entry.title: Is there a way to extract open accounting periods in public cloud?
entry.content:
Hi Dear Experts,

We are evaluating an interface to transfer sales data from an external system to SAP.
According to standard SAP behavior, I understand that when an accounting period is closed, posting a sales document (billing document) will result in a "Planned Posting" status.
This means the billing document can be created or updated, but it will not be posted to the general ledger (no accounting document is generated).

Problem Statement:
If a billing document cancellation is transmitted to SAP after the accounting period is closed, the billing document in SAP will be canceled.
Crucially:

  1. A canceled document cannot be "uncanceled" (reversal of cancellation is impossible).

  2. Even if a new credit memo ("Shin-Kuro Denpyo") is created, it will remain in an "Unposted" status.
    (This leads to inconsistent/incorrect data states).

Proposed Solution & Obstacle:
To prevent this, we intended to implement interface controls to block changes to billing documents after period closure.
However, our investigation revealed no standard API or CDS view to retrieve "Open" (unclosed) accounting periods in SAP Public Cloud ("Pabu Kura").
We therefore concluded that this control is currently infeasible via standard means.

Request:
Does SAP Public Cloud provide any method (e.g., API, CDS View, function module) to identify Open accounting periods?
If you have relevant information or implementation examples, we would greatly appreciate your guidance.

 

Please suggest.

Thank you very much.Best Regards!

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sales SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: S/4HANA Service Management for Utilities - do you need help moving?
entry.content:
Are you underway or planning to implement Service Management in S/4HANA?

Please let us know if you require help or product improvements. I hope you are aware of the new features, design changes, capabilities and simplifications when moving from CS to S/4HANA Service with Advanced Execution. Here is a refresher post Service Management for Utilities in S/4HANA.

Moving from CS to S/4HANA Service can seem like a lot of change. There are two programs I want to point out that can help you, the continuous influence program and the early adopter care.

 

Continuous influence

SAP customers and partners can request standard functionalty through this program. There are different programs, one for S/4HANA Service, another one for assets and so on. Maybe you know the utilities specific program? My colleage recently provided an update on SAP Continuous Influence Session for SAP S/4HANA Utilities: Status Update July 2025

The program for S/4HANA Service Management Cloud Private Edition can be found here  https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/3679

Please participate, by voting and by creating improvement requests. There are already several open requests from utilities. Be aware of the program rules. To qualify for a review and consideration, an improvement request requires at least 10 customer votes within 18 months in this program.

This is your chance to support a requirenent by voting. Below are a few relevant requests, many of them have not reached the required theshold yet:

Submitted, open for voting:

  • Compatible Units & Estimation Support for customer requested service work https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/326114
  • Applications for electrical interconnection supported in New Service with Advanced Execution https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/326119
  • New Service with Advanced Execution https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/327458
  • Appointment processing https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/326115
  • Quotation & Tariff Rate Support for Customer requested work https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/326117

Accepted (expected to be delivered):

  • Service Request as replacement of Service Notification (CS Notification) https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/312044  

 

Early Adopter Care

Are you interested in extra support while moving from CS to S/4HANA Service? SAP customers and partners can currently apply for Early Adopter Care. The registration remains open until December 2025, please find the details and conditions here https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/3904

 

Note that an S user is required to participate in these SAP programs, see knowledge base article 3014377 - Accessing the Continuous Influence Session "SAP S/4HANA Utilities".

We welcome your input and feedback to continuously improve SAP S/4HANA Utilities.

entry.title: Re: Error while triggering notification using Situation H...
entry.content:
Hi Jahnavi4,

this is a configuration issue for the notification framework that the Situation Handling Framework is "just" using, 
The answer from Dom might help, but I can't really judge. What might be handy is the general documentation for the Notification Framework
https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/fioritech/3362177584.html?locale=en-US
- Axel

entry.title: Run Template Cockpit: Actual Costing Ledger Run
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,


We are implementing Actual Costing Ledger Run in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) and found that no Run Template is available in the application “Cockpit: Actual Costing Ledger Run”.


Kindly help us configure a Run Template (e.g., MLRUN_STD) for ledger 0L and standard run type for our company code CA (Calvary)


Thank you.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: Re: No sufficient record found in control table
entry.content:
The issue is related to GST India: Official Document Numbering (ODN).

Please follow these steps to resolve it:

  1. Open transaction SM30 and enter the table/view name: J_1IG_V_OFNUM. Display the entries.

  2. Look for the Company Code, Business Place, and Document Class mentioned in the error message.

  3. Note down the Number Group (No. gp) and Number Range (No.) associated with these entries.

  4. Next, go to transaction SNRO and enter the object J_1IG_ODN.

  5. Choose Interval Editing, enter the noted Number Group, and select Edit Intervals.

  6. Maintain the number range as required.

After completing these steps, the issue should be resolved.

Thank you.

entry.title: Sales Order Changed to Complete when invoice status is Not Started
entry.content:
We have a sales order created and we delivered partially. The scenario here is the customer decided to cancel the remaining quantities. Therefore the item is cancelled through "Reason for Rejection" on the line item level. The question is why would the sales order close if we have not processed the customer invoicing? 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Sales Order Changed to Complete when invoice status i...
entry.content:
Dear requester,

When the sales order item is partially delivered, even the invoice is not yet invoiced, it is possible to cancel the remaining quantity. Since there is no open quantity in the order, the sales order becomes completed even the invoice status is Not Started. The delivery status of the item will be updated to Finished after the cancellation is saved.

The user is still able to further invoice the outbound delivery invoice request, and the invoice will then update the invoice status to Finished in the sales order afterwards.

It is confirmed with development team that this is the current designed system behavior for both manual entered sales orders and intercompany sales orders.

Thanks,

Adie

entry.title: Including Tax Information in Purchase Order Creation on SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Utilizing BAdI
entry.content:
How to Include Tax Item Information on Purchase Order output form?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Including Tax Information in Purchase Order Creation...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, no standard CDS views are available to retrieve tax information during purchase order creation. As a result, tax values cannot be transferred to output messages at this stage.
If Tax values need to be printed on Purchase Order Forms, a custom logic implementation is required. 

Here is a potential workaround for this missing functionality:

 

1. Create custom field at item level for the Purchase Order.

2. Populate this custom field with the tax amount to be printed. Note that in the current SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition release, there are no standard CDS views available to directly retrieve tax rates or tax codes.

Workaround 1:

To implement the desired code logic, BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PO_MODIFY_ITEM can be utilized.

  • Use this BAdI to calculate the tax amount as needed.
  • I_PurOrdItmPricingElementAPI01 is not filled while the order is saved.
  • Implement the  BADI calculating the values on your own logic code. 


Workaround 2:

To implement the required code logic, the BAdI MMPUR_PO_OUTPUT_HEADER_EXT/ITEM can be used.

The BAdI MMPUR_PO_OUTPUT_HEADER_EXT/ITEM can be used to implement custom logic for VAT calculation during output generation. It should be noted that this BAdI does not update the custom fields at the database level; changes will only be reflected on the output form.

This BAdI is invoked during output determination, which takes place after the purchase order is created. At that stage, the structure I_PurOrdItmPricingElementAPI01 already contains the relevant condition type values.

3. Enable custom field for output as demonstrated in this blog.

4. Adjust custom form template with the new field included.

Disclaimer: Any custom logic implemented with BAdIs falls outside the scope of SAP Technical Support.

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud : SAP Analytics Cloud のプロビジョニング
entry.content:
本ブログはSAP Business Data Cloud(SAP BDC)のプロビジョニング方法についてガイドします。
※本ブログの原文はこちらです。また、最新アップデート情報の確認のために、併せてSAP BDCのマニュアルもご確認ください。

このシリーズは、次の 5 つブログで構成されます。

Part 1: SAP for Me によるSAP BDCのプロビジョニング
Part 2: SAP Datasphere のプロビジョニング
Part 3: SAP Analytics Cloud のプロビジョニング
Part 4: SAP Databricks のプロビジョニング
Part 5: Intelligent Applications と Data Packages のインストール

今回は、「Part 3: SAP Analytics Cloud のプロビジョニング」です。

 

Part 3: SAP Analytics Cloud のプロビジョニング

本ブログでは、Business Data Cloud Core を介して SAP Analytics Cloud(SAC) をプロビジョニングする方法について説明します。

  1. BDCアプリケーションのプロビジョニングを開始します。今回はSAP Analytics Cloudのテナントを作成します。
  2. 表示される「SAP Analytics Cloudのプロビジョニング」ダイアログで、ソリューション名、リソースグループ、ビジネスタイプなどの詳細を入力します。
  3. ビジネスタイプでは、「テスト」または「本番」を選択できます。
  4. 「クォータ割り当て」セクションで、テナントのユーザー数を指定します。この数値は、SAP Business Data Cloudで利用可能な総Capacity Unitのうち、SAP Analytics Cloud に割り当てられるCapacity Unit 数に影響します。
  5. テスト環境の場合は、最低20人のユーザーを指定する必要があります。
  6. 本番環境を選択する場合、最低25人のSAC BIユーザーが必要です。また、SAC Planningを利用する場合は最低1人のPlanning Professionalユーザーと10人のPlanning Standardユーザーのいずれかを指定する必要があります。この最低要件を満たしていれば、利用可能なライセンスの種類は任意に組み合わせることができます。
  7. 設定パラメータセクションには、地域、システム所有者のメールアドレス、名前などの入力情報が含まれています。BDC コックピットのプロビジョニングに以前選択した地域と同じ地域を選択してください。
  8. 設定情報を確認して、情報を送信してください。
  9. プロビジョニングリクエストが送信されたことを通知する確認メッセージが表示されます。
  10. 指定されたリソースグループ内のテナントを表示するには、「リソースで表示」をクリックします。
  11. リソースタブでは、ソリューションのステータスは「処理中」で、プロビジョニングが完了すると「準備完了」に変わります。
  12. プロビジョニング時に指定されたSAP Analytics Cloudのシステム所有者は、テナントがプロビジョニングされると電子メール通知を受け取ります。
  13. テナントの準備ができたら、「リソース」タブの下のリンクとテナントの詳細からテナントにアクセスできるようになります。
  14. 「顧客ランドスケープ」では、新しいテナントのシステムの詳細を確認できます。また、システム統合が視覚的に表示されるため、システムランドスケープの理解と操作が容易になります。
  15. 既に作成したBDCテナントを追加した「Formation」にテナントを追加する必要があります。
  16. 製品とポートフォリオ > Business Data Cloud > 顧客ランドスケープ > Formation に移動します。
  17. 正しいFormationを選択し、「システムを含める」をクリックして、Formationに含めるSACテナントを選択し、変更を保存します。
  18. 単一のSAP Analytics Cloudテナントは、1つのFormationにのみ属することができ、複数のフォーメーションに属することはできません。

これで、BDC Core内でSAP Analytics Cloudテナントが正常にプロビジョニングされました。


※ このブログの原文を書いてくれたShreyasri Boseに感謝します。

entry.title: Re: Error deleting BP ID via FM BAPI_IDENTIFICATION_REMOV...
entry.content:
You should be aware, direct updates to master data tables like BUT0ID are not recommended without SAP’s guidance. Of course, you can standardize all BP Identification Numbers to uppercase before deletion. This involves reading the existing entries from table BUT0ID, Converting the IDENTIFICATIONNUMBER field to uppercase using ABAP logic, Updating the entries via a custom report or enhancement (if allowed). Then retrying BAPI_IDENTIFICATION_REMOVE with the uppercase value.

If the above option is not viable or if data integrity is at risk, raise an incident with SAP Support referencing SAP Note 2745718. Request a workaround or enhancement that allows deletion regardless of case sensitivity. SAP may provide a patch or alternative FM that bypasses the uppercase check.

entry.title: Consolidating Customer Planning: Unleash Growth with SAP Revenue Growth Management’s Account Plan
entry.content:
1. The Fragmented Reality of CPG Account Management

For Key Account Managers (KAMs) in the consumer products industry, managing complex customer promotion plans is often a juggling act. You’ve probably experienced the frustration of scattered information of accounts, baseline volumes, targets & measures, assortments, and trade funds—all while struggling to align your promotions with corporate KPIs. This fragmentation isn’t just inefficient; it obscures strategic insights, delays adjustments, and risks revenue leakage.

 

2. SAP Revenue Growth Management: The Unified Engine

SAP Revenue Growth Management transforms how Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies drive profitability. By integrating trade promotion, funds management, and analytics into a single platform, our solution turns raw data into actionable growth levers. At its core is the Account Plan —a dynamic workspace where KAMs centralize customer strategy, align resources, and track progress against goals. Unlike siloed systems, SAP Revenue Growth Management (RGM) consolidates data across promotions, baselines, and financial targets, ensuring every action ladders up to the profit and loss (P&L).

For more information on our current capabilities, see An Overview of SAP Revenue Growth Management.  

 

3. Account Planning in Action: Three Keys to Customer-Centric Trade Promotion Success

Here’s how the Account Plan in SAP Revenue Growth Management addresses your core challenges and supports your success:

 

3.1. Centralized Customer Account Intelligence: The Heart of Your Revenue Growth Management Strategy

Building an effective promotion plan starts with knowing your customer — from the available trade funds and product lists to baseline volumes and planned promotions. The Account Plan within SAP Revenue Growth Management centralizes all this critical information in one place, giving KAMs a holistic view of their account KPIs and metrics. 

  • Holistic Baseline and Assortment Management

The Account Plan integrates baselines—whether imported from demand planning systems or uploaded and maintained manually—mapped clearly to the product lists assigned to that account, creating a solid foundation for promotion management. 

  • Integrated Promotion and Fund Tracking

Within an Account Plan, a KAM can have a whole picture into all related promotions and manage planned promotions directly, either in a list view or in a calendar view, along with associated trade funds allocated and tracked via SAP Revenue Growth Management’s funds management feature. This integration allows KAMs to monitor investment allocation and consumption against plan targets, avoiding surprises.

This centralization cuts tedious manual data compilation and gives KAMs a clear “single source of truth” to guide their day-to-day decisions and ultimately meet growth targets. 

 

3.2. Agile Assortment Control:  Automated Selection and User Flexibility

Not every retailer stocks the same products year-round — seasonal items, product launches, discontinuations, and regional preferences all demand flexible planning. Additionally, the product list may differ for each retailer. To effectively manage this, SAP Revenue Growth Management leverages central assortments for efficiency while enabling KAMs to keep granular control to adapt to customer-specific needs.

  • Automated Determination of Central Assortments

Assortments are predefined groups of products assigned to specific customers and sales areas for designated time periods. SAP Revenue Growth Management automatically applies the most relevant central assortment at the lowest (i.e., most granular) customer level to one or more respective account plans, sparing KAMs unnecessary manual effort.

  • User-Friendly Overrides with Product Lists

While the central assortment sets the default product scope, KAMs have the flexibility to make specific modifications on a per-account basis under the Product List, including adding or removing products and editing product validity periods that define when a product is available for inclusion into a promotion plan. These manual changes do not affect the central assortment usually managed by administrators but are clearly shown in the user interface, helping KAMs review modifications and avoid errors. 

By combining automated assortment determination with controlled flexibility, the Account Plan stays both efficient and aligned with real-world customer agreements and ever-changing market demands.

 

3.3 Intuitive Account Plan Dashboard: Visualizing Plans to Drive Actions 

Keeping multiple account plans at different levels of the customer hierarchy organized and tracked can be challenging, especially if you manage numerous retailers or regions. With SAP Revenue Growth Management, KAMs always have clear visibility into their planning progress.

  • Quick Overview with Customizable KPIs

From a predefined list, KAMs can select up to four KPIs (e.g., trade spend, volume, gross sales value, trade rate) most relevant to each account plan. Moreover, based on business requirements and priorities, one KPI can be pinned for primary display on the dashboard, empowering KAMs to monitor progress towards targets and easily identify areas requiring action. 

  • Visual Indicators for Plan Readiness

The Account Plan Dashboard page provides a quick and effective overview of the situation across all account plans managed by a KAM. On the dashboard, the pinned KPI is color-coded, green for solid plans likely to achieve goals based on current planning data and red for accounts with overspent funds or unmet goals, with key figures for other selected KPIs displayed, making it fast and intuitive to spot risks or areas needing attention, so KAMs can adjust plans and prioritize actions confidently.

This color-coded dashboard insight helps KAMs stay on top of their portfolio’s health and proactively enhance plans, maximizing their growth contribution. 

 

4. Co-Innovation: Your Strategic Partner for Customer Account Success

The Account Plan in SAP Revenue Growth Management is more than a data repository—it’s an agile, integrated workspace designed to simplify your customer account planning while driving profitability.

If you face challenges such as:

  • not having a unified dynamic workspace that consolidates key business data
  • managing seasonal product lists in an intuitive way
  • limited visibility into promotion plans and revenue targets

Join our co-innovation program, where you can collaborate with us to shape the future of the Account Plan, unlocking new capabilities that address your business needs. 

Contact us today to get started! mail RGM_Engage@sap.com to get involved and help create the next generation of revenue growth excellence.

entry.title: Re: Customer Special G/L Indicator in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content: As per SAP note 2761212, you can use SSCUI ID 100297 to define alternative reconciliation accounts for existing Special G/L transactions. This lets you tailor postings without needing new indicators.
